course.subject: LANG
course.name: English Communication for Humanities and Social Science Studies I
course.description: Restricted to students in programs offered by the School of Humanities and Social Science. The course is an integrated skills course with a special emphasis on critical reading and thinking. It develops students' ability to understand the nuances of English vocabulary and to assimilate information from different sources for analysis and commentary. The course also hones students' skills in giving effective academic presentations.
course.prerequisites: CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1003 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.comment_content:
Basically a revisit to the things taught in year one. The course schedule is attached for reference.

Quite a number of "lessons" are actually consultations sessions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say it is not bad. At least she explains clearly, provides examples, and encourages us to speak up.

She also gives advice on how to improve my essay and presentations.
reviews.comment_grading:
The assessment percentage allocation is also attached for reference.

No statistics or marks for assessments were released whatsoever. The only thing I know is that our group got the highest marks in the final presentation.

DISCLAIMER: I got A grades for LANG1002 and 1003, so I dare not to comment on what the grading is actually like (as there may be a survivorship bias). I am not sure whether she penalizes greatly if your English level is not that sophisticated.

I was initially quite anxious about the grading considering the previous reviews, but it turned out okay (from my perspective).

My grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is mainly the essay, the infographic presentation, and the final group presentation. Depending on your English level and research, the workload can be intermediate or slightly heavy.

I think the infographic poster can be quite troublesome.
